name: Mare's Tail

Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: ribbon-like (1 – 10cm), entire, no petiole, in whorls of 6 – 12, emergent leaves blunt with hard tips, submersed leaves elongate, flaccid, sometimes paler
Flowers: June to September, small, inconspicuous, located in leaf base, lack petal and sepals, are educed to a tiny rim
Habitat: Damp shores, shallow quiet waters of ponds and streams
Fresh or brackish water, prefers non-acidic conditions
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, much of the United States
